page.title: 10A Publican's Day
page.content: At 10am I check the barrels by turning the pump on and pulling beer into the bucket. Then I bottle up. This means restocking the shelves in the bar with bottles from the cellar. Their tops have to be wiped with a damp cloth. My wife counts up. This means checking all the money from the night before. We open at 11am to serve the early customers and close at 2.30pm. In the evening we are open from 5.30 until 11pm. I enjoy the work because it us nice meeting and talking to people. Funnily enough we are usually busier in the winter than in the summer because we are not near the tourist attractions and in the summer the holiday makers go to the pubs near the sea front.
